articles.title: Oil's fall brings inflation comfort for RBI
articles.description: While food inflation remains a concern, the second-order effects from higher input prices are likely to be more benign than initially estimated. Lower commodity prices, particularly of crude oil, should reduce risks of imported inflation.
articles.content: Mumbai: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) may not need to revise upward its inflation forecast for FY23 as global prices of crude oil and other commodities, such as industrial metals, have begun soften… [+2654 chars]
